intro: Solidago dispersa, commonly known as the scattered goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting various pollinators. Solidago dispersa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
